column4: Hello. Is it worth upgrading the kernel to 'linux-image-686' instead of the default -386 ?
can give a bit of a speed boost
no
ok, I tried google, but I can't figure out how to upgrade a kernel "the Debian way".
install the package. reboot.
That's it? apt-get install and reboot? Wow.
g1gaman: Shouldn't there be a way to (say) mount /usr on the 1.7 GB drive and mount / on the 1 GB?
sure, you can do that during the install
are you behind NAT?
I don't know what a NAT is.
then tell us how yo uare connected to the internet
Home network -> DSL router
how many ip addresses did your isp give you?
if you don't know, the anser is 1 and you are nat'ed.
The configuration wizard of Azureus says "NAT error", so whatever a NAT is, that's probably the problem.
Okay, I mus be NAT'ed.
in which case you need to configure your router to forward a port to you, then you need to configure azarues to use that port.
no
you need to configure your router to forward a particular port in to your desktop
ok
set router to forward port 6881 to my computer, got it.
yes, exactly
